ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò la tɔ́g, Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa, ńne ńgwá ńgiŋe, à te ne ńkwoŋo légʉa tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅindê wɔ́, mélàʼmie pasáʼa láʼa pà Yúndà la ne faʼa lézẅé yé.
en: After this, Jesus traveled in Galilee,   since he did not want to travel in Judea  # 7:1 Lk 1:5 because the Jews  # 7:1 Jn 11:36 were trying to kill him.  # 7:1 Jn 5:18

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, alínɔ̀ɔn pà Yúndà gie mé tóŋo lê línɔ̀ɔn mentàb, á ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: The Jewish Festival of Shelters  ,# 7:2 Ex 23:16 was near.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Fó jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa né Jẅindê tá megàŋakwò pù pie ée jʉʼó, e gyá yɔ́b menò mie ɔ̀ ne ńgÿo.
en: So his brothers   said to him, “Leave here and go to Judea so that your disciples can see your works  # 7:3 Mk 6:28; Jn 5:36; Heb 3:9; Rv 15:3 that you are doing.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zsé yé, á le lÿoon mmó gie à ne ńgÿo wɔ́. Páʼ, ɔ̀ ne ńgÿo memǎa menò la, gÿo, aláʼ zsé ɔ́.»
en: For no one does anything in secret while he’s seeking public recognition. If you do these things, show yourself to the world.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtí nue kwàʼ pɔ́b mefɛ̌ Yěsô la te ne ńzába ntʉ́m na yé wɔ́.
en: (For not even his brothers believed in him.)

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼ nyé te kuʼ, tá ńgʉa na pi, mbà fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ áa mbwó pi ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Jesus told them, “My time    has not yet arrived, but your time is always at hand.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ epʉ̀a njÿó legẅi pʉ̀a. Tá ńgʉa na mèŋ, mbà pɔ́ pʉa wɔ́ɔn, mélàʼmie n kě ńne shwóŋo wɔ́b shwóŋ ngie ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b té poŋ.
en: The world cannot hate    you, but it does hate me because I testify about it #— #that its works are evil.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ pʉ ńgʉa jʉʼʉ línɔ̀ɔn. Á gʉa na mèŋ, mbà n tě ńgee né wó wɔ́, ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼ kaa kuʼu.»
en: Go up to the festival yourselves. I’m not going up to this festival,    because my time has not yet fully come.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b púʼu, ńgíŋ ńnéŋe Ngalílîa.
en: After he had said these things, he stayed in Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pé piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbʉ né jʉʼʉ línɔ̀ɔn, á leen ńké ńcʉ́m yé mánzsè. Tá ńgiŋ pɔ́ shú shǔ.
en: After his brothers had gone up to the festival, then he also went up, not openly but secretly.

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ tà ne ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn, pasáʼa láʼa pà Yúndà ne ńgwá faʼa yé, ńzɛ́te ngie: «Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?»
en: The Jews were looking for him at the festival and saying, “Where is he? ”

ngiemboon: Aláʼ ne shwóŋe mencwò mencwò ńtí Yěsô. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Aa kwàʼ nyìŋ.» Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «À fʉte pʉ̀a fʉte.»
en: And there was a lot of murmuring about him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He’s a good   man.” Others were saying, “No, on the contrary, he’s deceiving  # 7:12 Rv 20:10 the people.”

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ ké těen ńgɔɔn nò na yé tà ngyè ye kwɔ́ʼɔ tÿǒ wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ pasáʼa láʼa pà Yúndà.
en: Still, nobody was talking publicly about him for fear of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿó línɔ̀ɔn tà ńgebe, Yěsô gʉa né ndá Ssé, ńzye lézíʼi pʉ̀a mmó.
en: When the festival was already half over, Jesus went up into the temple   and began to teach.

ngiemboon: Á kʉʼʉ pasáʼa láʼ pà Yúndà, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: «À gÿo lêkɔ́ ńzsé Ŋwàʼne Ssé pɛ́ʼɛ̀, tá mbà à la te sekúd zíʼi?»
en: Then the Jews were amazed and said, “How is this man so learned,   since he hasn’t been trained? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ammó gie n ziʼi pʉ̀a, á téen fóo mbwó mèŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à ka tumó wɔ́ɔn.
en: Jesus answered them, “My teaching isn’t mine but is from the one who sent me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà ngàŋ ge zsé, ka mmó gie n ziʼi pʉ̀a, á fóo pɔ́ mbwó Ssé wɔ́ɔ, ka á gwɔ́ pɔ́ yɔ́ɔn shwóŋè wɔ́ɔ.
en: If anyone wants to do his will,    he will know whether the teaching is from God or whether I am speaking on my own.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńgɔɔn nò, ńgwɔ́ gie á gwɔ́ pɔ́ shwóŋè yé, mbà à faʼa pɔ́ we legúʼ. Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne faʼa legúʼ nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńtúmo yé, mbà ngàŋ shwóŋo nò nénʉ́, atsɔ́ nò ŋwɔʼte ŋwɔʼté té na yé wɔ́.
en: The one who speaks on his own seeks his own glory;    but he who seeks the glory   # 7:18 Lk 9:32; Jn 17:24; 2Co 3:18; 1Pt 5:4; 2Pt 3:18 of the one who sent him is true,   # 7:18 Jn 8:14; 1Jn 5:20 and there is no unrighteousness in him.   # 7:18 1Jn 3:5

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê zɔ la te ná meŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ né pi wɔ́ le? Tà wɔ̌ na pi mɔ̌ɔn ńne ńgiŋe mǒ? Pi piŋe éfaʼa lézẅé wɔ́ɔn mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: Didn’t Moses    give you the law? Yet none of you keeps the law.   # 7:19 Rm 2:12–29; 3:9–10,20–23,27–28 Why are you trying to kill me? ”

ngiemboon: Aláʼ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Yěsô ngie: «E ssé tepòŋ ee na gù! Awɔ̌ ne faʼa lézẅé gú?»
en: “You have a demon! ” the crowd responded. “Who is trying to kill you? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «N ka gÿo pɔ́ ndàʼ tàʼa mmó, á pú ńgege gẅí metsèm.
en: “I performed one work,    and you are all amazed,” Jesus answered.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi ké ńjúʼ, Mǒonsê la zíʼi gẅí lépúʼu múɔ mbàŋa, á fó těen éfóo pɔ́ né yé Mǒonsê wɔ́, á fóo mbwó pamángʉanjʉʼ. Pi piŋ ńne ḿbúʼu múɔ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse gí.
en: “This is why Moses has given you circumcision    #— #not that it comes from Moses but from the fathers   # 7:22 Gn 17:9–14; Lv 12:3 #— #and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.   # 7:22 Mk 2:23

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ngwɔ́ pi púʼu múɔ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ pi ge fʉa lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê, mbà pi piŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ na mèŋ ngie n gÿǒ nyìŋ zeŋe lyɛʼɛ́ nzse mélàʼakɔ́?
en: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath    so that the law of Moses   # 7:23 Lk 2:22 won’t be broken, are you angry at me because I made a man entirely well on the Sabbath?

ngiemboon: Tà pi ŋaga nò nyìŋ té zsé letsiŋé, pi ŋag pɔ́ páʼ áa jʉʼó ńgwɔ́ púʼu.»
en: Stop judging    according to outward appearances; rather judge according to righteous judgment.”

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Wɛ̂ te nyìŋ wa gẅie mé faʼa lézẅé yé la wáa?
en: Some of the people of Jerusalem   were saying, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?

ngiemboon: Yé wɛ̂, ńne shʉashʉa ńgɔɔn nò, nyìŋ těen ńtsɔ́bɔ wɔ́. Ndyɛ̀ʼ pasáʼa láʼ pégè gyǎ ngie aa Nzàʼnkÿo nénʉ́.
en: Yet, look, he’s speaking publicly and they’re saying nothing to him. Can it be true that the authorities   know he is the Messiah?  # 7:26 Mt 1:17; Eph 5:2

ngiemboon: Táʼ, wɛ̂ nyìŋ aa pɛ́ʼɛ̀ peg ne ńzsé jʉʼ gie à fóo wó. Tá ńgʉa na Nzàʼnkÿo, mbà nyìŋ te gÿo zsé jʉʼ gie à fóo wó wɔ́.»
en: But we know where this man is from.   When the Messiah comes, nobody will know where he is from.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ fʉʼó, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Ssé ńne ńzíʼi pʉ̀a mmó, ńgɔɔn né ngyè tetʉ̂ ngie: «Pi kwàʼ ńne ńzsé wɔ́ɔn, ńgíŋ ńne ńzsé jʉʼ gie mèŋ fóo lé wó! Mèŋ zɔ ka te záb ngie n ge tó wɔ́. Táʼ, nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ́ɔn, aa nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn nò, mbà áa nò nénʉ́. Pi te ne ńzsé yé wɔ́.
en: As he was teaching in the temple,   Jesus cried out, “You know me and you know where I am from. Yet I have not come on my own, but the one who sent me   # 7:28 Jn 5:19 is true. You don’t know him;   # 7:28 Jn 1:26–33; 5:13; 8:14,19,55; 9:29–30; 12:35; 13:7; 14:5; 15:15,21; 20:14; Gl 4:8; 1Th 4:5; 2Th 1:8; Ti 1:16

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n kě ne ńzsé yé. Mèŋ fóo pɔ́ né lejʉ́ŋ yé, mbà yé zɔ ka tumó wɔ́ɔn.»
en: I know him because I am from him, and he sent me.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ júʼu yɔɔn nò, éfaʼa légwoon yé, tá nyìŋ ké te pwó na yé záb, mélàʼmie ayé fʉ̀ʼ la nyé pɔ́ te kuʼ.
en: Then they tried to seize him. Yet no one laid a hand on him because his hour had not yet come.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ láʼ ké ne ńzába ntʉ́m na yé zǎb, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tà Nzàʼnkÿo ge gÿo tó, é gíŋ gÿo tsɔ́ menò mɔɔnmɔɔn tà e tɔ́g mie nyìŋ wɛ̂ ne ńgÿo lá?»
en: However, many from the crowd believed in him and said, “When the Messiah comes, he won’t perform more signs than this man has done,   will he? ”

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè júʼ páʼ aláʼ ne shÿɔ́gɔ ncwò ssé ńkíme Yěsô, ńgʉa ńgyá metándá panuŋepwɔʼ pâ pɔ̌ túm papyɛ́bɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńgwoon Yěsô.
en: The Pharisees   heard the crowd murmuring these things about him, and so the chief priests  # 7:32 Mt 2:4 and the Pharisees sent servants  # 7:32 Or temple police, or officers, also in vv. 45,46 to arrest him.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: «Pege ge gíŋ náʼa néŋe, n gʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ́ɔn.
en: Then Jesus said, “I am only with you for a short time.    Then I’m going to the one who sent me.   # 7:33 Jn 14:12; 16:5,10,17,28

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gwá faʼa wɔ́ɔn, é piŋ ké le wɔ́ɔn gyá, á nue ajʉʼ gie n gee né wó, pi te kuʼu létóo jʉʼó wɔ́.»
en: You will look for me, but you will not find me; and where I am, you cannot come.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a zye légɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Aa páʼɔɔn ńgee pɔ́ né nzɔ̌, tà peg le yé gyá lɛ? À ge gʉa kẅɛ́te pɔ́ pʉ̀a pégè pie é la sa jʉʼ, ńgee láʼ pà Ngelékiya keen? Kà à gee pɔ́ ńzíʼi pà Ngelékiya nò Ssé?
en: Then the Jews   said to one another, “Where does he intend to go that we won’t find him? He doesn’t intend to go to the Jewish people dispersed  # 7:35 Gk diaspora; Jewish people scattered throughout Gentile lands,# 7:35 Jms 1:1; 1Pt 1:1 among the Greeks  # 7:35 Gl 2:3 and teach the Greeks, does he?

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ntí shwóŋè ee páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́, páʼ à gɔɔn ngie: “Pi ge faʼa wɔ́ɔn é piŋ ké le wɔ́ɔn gyá, ḿbiŋ te kuʼu létóo jʉʼ gie n gee wó wɔ́ɔ?”»
en: What is this remark he made: ‘You will look for me, and you will not find me; and where I am, you cannot come’   ? ”

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nzsònzèm lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn, á gie áa máamáa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, Yěsô lu ssé ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn né ngyè tetʉ̂ ngie: «Agága nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne shÿó, á tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ́ɔn, ńnú ntse.
en: On the last and most important day of the festival,   Jesus stood up and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me   # 7:37 Other mss omit to me,# 7:37 Lk 14:26 and drink.   # 7:37 Is 55:1; Rv 22:17

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé na mèŋ la, mbà nò gie Ŋwàʼne Ssé gɔɔn ge pumte: “Ntse ge fó tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wé, é kẅɛ, é ne cwóŋo páʼ ntse gẅie é fóo lesaʼá la.”»
en: The one who believes in me,    as the Scripture   # 7:38 Mt 26:54 has said, will have streams of living water   # 7:38 Jn 4:10–14 flow   # 7:38 Ex 17:1–6; Ps 78:15–16; 105:40–41; Pr 18:4; Is 12:3; Ezk 47:1–11; Zch 14:8; Rv 22:1–2 from deep within him.”

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńgɔɔn Zẅìge Ssé gie pʉ̀a pie é zǎb ntʉ́m na yé lɔ́ɔn ńge kẅé. Á gwaa gwɔ́, À Zẅìge Ssé ŋwɛ́ nyé té tó, á nue Yěsô la nyé te kǔu tsɛ̀ɛ legúʼ we.
en: He said this about the Spirit.   Those who believed in Jesus were going to receive the Spirit,  # 7:39 Ac 2:33 for the Spirit  # 7:39 Other mss read Holy Spirit had not yet been given  # 7:39 Lit the Spirit was not yet because Jesus had not yet been glorified.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ júʼu shwóŋè Yěsô, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie: «Aa kwàʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé.»
en: When some from the crowd heard these words, they said, “This truly is the Prophet.”

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie yé zɔɔ Nzàʼnkÿo. Táʼ, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie Nzàʼnkÿo lɔɔn ngwɔ́ á le fó Ngalílîa wɔ́.
en: Others said, “This is the Messiah.” But some said, “Surely the Messiah doesn’t come from Galilee, does he?

ngiemboon: Ńtí nue mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: «Nzàʼnkÿo ge láʼ fó pɔ́ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavîd, ngie Nzàʼnkÿo ge láʼ fó pɔ́ Mbɛ́tèlehɛm á gẅie áa láʼ pà fùɔ Ndavîd.»
en: Doesn’t the Scripture   say that the Messiah comes from David’s  # 7:42 Lk 1:27 offspring  # 7:42 Lit seed and from the town of Bethlehem,  # 7:42 Gn 35:19 where David lived? ”

ngiemboon: Anò Yěsô leen ńké ḿmaʼa fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: So the crowd was divided   because of him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a na pɔ́b ne faʼa légwoon Yěsô, táʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb ké te kuʼu lézába pwó na yé wɔ́.
en: Some of them wanted to seize him,   but no one laid hands on him.

ngiemboon: Papyɛ́bɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé pie mé ně ńtúmo wɔ́b piŋ nzèm ńkẅɛ́te metándá panuŋepwɔʼ lâ pafalísáyè, pɔ́ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ kaa lɔgɔ Yěsô ńtó wɔ́ mélàʼakɔ́?
en: Then the servants   came to the chief priests  # 7:45 Mt 2:4 and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why didn’t you bring him? ”

ngiemboon: Papyɛ́bɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Peg laa zɔɔn ńjúʼ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ shwóŋo páʼ nyìŋ awɛ̌ wɔ́!»
en: The servants answered, “No man ever spoke like this! ”  ,# 7:46 Mt 7:28–29

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Ńzsé ngie à selé twó gí gí wɔ́ɔ?
en: Then the Pharisees responded to them, “Are you fooled   too?

ngiemboon: Tsoon tsɔ̌ tàʼ na mekěm pég, tsoon tàʼ na pafalísáyè laa záb ntʉ́m na nyìŋ awɛ̌ wɔ́!
en: Have any of the rulers   or Pharisees believed in him?

ngiemboon: Táʼ, anùɔ láʼ yɛ̂ gie á te Ŋwàʼne Ssé zsé, ée megàŋ ndòon.»
en: But this crowd, which doesn’t know the law, is accursed.”

ngiemboon: Pafalísáyè ne ńzoŋo páʼɔɔn, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b, á Níkondem, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la gʉa ńgyá Yěsô. Á néŋe tà ńgɔɔn né yetsɔ́ kwò yɔ́b ngie:
en: Nicodemus    #— #the one who came to him previously and who was one of them #— #said to them,

ngiemboon: «Áa na lepʉ̌ ségè péʼe, mé gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ gwě ntsaŋ té gwɔ́ gie mé juʼú nò gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò yé, ḿbiŋ ńzsé mmó gie à gÿǒ?»
en: “Our law doesn’t judge a man before it hears from him and knows what he’s doing, does it? ”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ɔɔ jú nyìŋ Ngalílîa ka? Ɔ̀ lɔɔn éfaʼ mboŋó, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá ngie atsɔ̌ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé laa kẅɛɛ Ngalílîa wɔ́.»
en: “You aren’t from Galilee   too, are you? ” they replied. “Investigate and you will see that no prophet arises from Galilee.”  # 7:52 2Kg 14:25

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo púʼu, ésyeente, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gʉa né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Then each one went to his house.
